You are the son of my late Teddu Abbulu. As such
you are
my grandson. With the intention of giving you some property free of charge in return for the love I have for you, I hereby transfer to you the property as per the schedule below, which is part of the property of my late husband, the late Teddu Subbarao, and which has come to me with full rights after him. I hereby transfer the property to you free of charge and execute this gift settlement deed and transfer the said property to you on this day itself. From the date of the gift, I have enjoyed the said property with full rights and enjoyment. From this, you shall enjoy the said property freely and happily with all the rights of donation and sale, as well as with all the rights of your sons and grandsons. I assure you that I have not committed any wrongdoings in this regard. I have no objections to this and I will settle all disputes arising from any cause whatsoever at my own expense and will continue to execute it without any delay under you. The property has not been registered under Act No. 9/77. I agree to be liable for any legal action taken if any facts are found to have been concealed in the property and to pay the depreciation tax. Schedule:- Peddapuram Sub-Registry, Peddapuram Mandal, Peddapuram Village Taluk, Peddapuram Municipality, East Godavari District, T.S. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 332 of 2013, dated 11/Feb/2013, executed by Teddu Bangaramma, in favour of her Grandson, Teddu Subrahmanyam Rep. by Teddu Mariyamma [Guardian], towards the property admeasuring an extent of 52.10 Sq. Yds, dismantled house number 1-1-1, Ward No. 3, comprised in survey number 1-14-1075, situated in Kondayyapeta Street, Peddapuram Village, Muncipality and Mandal, erstwhile East Godavari District, now within the District of Kakinada, registered at Sub-Registrar Office Peddapuram(407), is bounded as follows: North by: 34 ft Rajaveedhi South by: 27.6 ft site of Teddu Srinubaba East by:14 ft house site of Mortha Marthamma West by: 6.6 ft Rajaveedhi

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note:: 1. It is pertinent to note that Teddu Subramanyam was a minor at the time of the deed's registration, and court permission should have been obtained before executing the deed. However, he is now a major, and the F.I. has stated that he was included in the loan structure. Furthermore, due to the passage of time and the expiration of the limitation period, it is opined that no legal claim may arise on his behalf. Hence we are proceeding with the report on this pretext. However, it is, advisable for F.I. to verify his age using a government-issued proof of age document. 2. It is to be noted that EC was not obtained with given survey number available in the given pledging deed, hence, EC is verified only through Document Number and Dismantled House Number not through property details. Hence, F.I. to verify the same. Further, It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, and Split/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
